Key Match Events: Anrich Nortje successfully defended 13 runs in the final over in a tense finish
Kagiso Rabada had Liam Livingstone caught at deep backward square off a full toss
Marco Jansen sent down a phenomenal penultimate over, bowling into the pitch and taking pace off, and conceded only seven runs
Harry Brook was caught by Aiden Markram off Anrich Nortje's bowling
Post-Match Reflections: England may not too be unhappy after the close defeat
Their spinners Moeen Ali and Adil Rashid were impressive
Reece Topley conceded only 23 in his four overs
Harry Brook brought up his first T20 World Cup fifty
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa didn't seem to have enough runs, having scored 63 in the powerplay but only another 100 in the next 14 overs
Their quicks did not appear to have fully bought into pace-off, giving away 52 runs in three overs between the 15th and 17th over
Others: Is it too early to say it? That it looks like South Africa's time has come
South Africa beat defending champions England in a thrilling encounter
England will still fancy their chances of reaching the semi-final
Quinton de Kock's fifty was the big difference between the teams
